intro: Clitandra semlikiensis, commonly known as the Semliki sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by yellowish fruits containing oval seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and plays a role in local ecosystems as a habitat and food source for various wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is also of interest for conservation efforts.
